did.abstract: The Walter J. Handleman collection of Downtown Brooklyn photographs consist of three black-and-white photographic prints showing buildings located in the vicinity of Fulton Street and Clinton Street in the neighborhood of Downtown Brooklyn, 1942 to 1954.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library under the object ID prefix V1990.74.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection's digital surrogates should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Walter J. Handleman collection of Downtown Brooklyn photographs consist of three black-and-white photographic prints showing buildings located in the vicinity of Fulton Street and Clinton Street in the neighborhood of Downtown Brooklyn, 1942 to 1954. The Hotel Touraine and the Clinton Garage are shown in the photographs. The photographs are street views and show period cars and trucks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, all photographs in the collection will enter the public domain by 2074. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
